bug.author: rcurtin
bug.summary: Go Azure builds seem to be unable to find gonum
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Issue description</denchmark-h>
The Azure builds for Go fail to install gonum when configuring the Go bindings: <denchmark-link:https://dev.azure.com/mlpack/84320e87-76e3-4b6e-8b6e-3adaf6b36eed/_apis/build/builds/2694/logs/38>https://dev.azure.com/mlpack/84320e87-76e3-4b6e-8b6e-3adaf6b36eed/_apis/build/builds/2694/logs/38</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h4>Your environment</denchmark-h>
version of mlpack: git master operating system: Linux / OS X on Azure compiler: gcc 5.5.0 (wow I am surprised it is so old on the Azure systems but that's ok) version of dependencies (Boost/Armadillo): 1.70.0 / 8.400.0 any other environment information you think is relevant:
<denchmark-h:h4>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
The Azure builds can reproduce this; it seems like every time the Go bindings are built (I think). To reproduce a PR can be opened and the failure will happen pretty quickly. :) <denchmark-h:h4>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The Go bindings should successfully configure and build. :) <denchmark-h:h4>Actual behavior</denchmark-h>
From go get -u -t gonum.org/v1/gonum/...: <denchmark-code>package gonum.org/v1/gonum/...: unrecognized import path "gonum.org/v1/gonum": reading https://gonum.org/v1/gonum?go-get=1: 404 Not Found </denchmark-code>
Then from CMake: <denchmark-code>2020-06-21T01:20:01.2554228Z -- Found Go: /usr/bin/go (found suitable version "1.14.4", minimum required is "1.11.0") 2020-06-21T01:20:01.2583439Z can't load package: package gonum.org/v1/gonum/mat: cannot find package "gonum.org/v1/gonum/mat" in any of: 2020-06-21T01:20:01.2584486Z /opt/hostedtoolcache/go/1.14.4/x64/src/gonum.org/v1/gonum/mat (from $GOROOT) 2020-06-21T01:20:01.2585102Z /home/vsts/work/1/s/build/src/gonum.org/v1/gonum/mat (from $GOPATH) 2020-06-21T01:20:01.2647462Z -- Gonum not found (missing: GONUM_VERSION_STRING) 2020-06-21T01:20:01.2648324Z CMake Error at src/mlpack/bindings/go/CMakeLists.txt:27 (message): 2020-06-21T01:20:01.2648801Z Go or Gonum not found; unable to build Go bindings! </denchmark-code>
This turns out to be caused by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/gonum/website/issues/9>gonum/website#9</denchmark-link> ; but I thought it would be useful to open an issue here too for awareness; we can resolve it once the upstream issue is resolved.

comments.comment: This appears to be fixed now. üëç
